cluster_relations.rel_desc: Twitter serves as a platform used by underrepresented communities.

cluster_relations.object_class_group: Marginalization, Representation & Inclusion in Social Media

cluster_relations.object_class_label: Social Justice Narratives on Social Media
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Social Media and Online Social Interaction

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Twitter enables underrepresented communities to advocate for social or political change.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject platform or medium enables or facilitates actors' advocacy efforts aimed at achieving social or political change.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Social Media: Impacts and Social Change

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject makes possible or substantially facilitates the existence, occurrence, use, or spread of the object (e.g., a capability, behavior, content, or impact).
args.justification: This relation (Twitter enabling advocacy for social or political change) is the same general platform enablement pattern as the other Twitter→X relations in this chunk. Normalizing the canonical_rel_name to 'enables', aligning the description with the existing generic enablement definition, and unifying rel_cls to 'platform_enablement_relation' with rel_cls_group 'CAUSALITY' removes unnecessary predicate and class variants and keeps a consistent schema for platform enablement edges.
args.remark: More specific nuances about advocacy and change can remain in the relation description and qualifiers; the predicate-level meaning is generic enablement, shared with the other Twitter enablement relations.
